entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is mentioned as the one being asked by someone about what he's up to. He is also referred to as 'you' in the conversation.

entities.name: fred
entities.description: Fred is mentioned as giving a serious response to Ron's question. He explains that learning to peel sprouts without magic is character-building and helps appreciate how difficult it is for Muggles and Squibs.

entities.name: george
entities.description: George is mentioned as adding to Fred's explanation. He also mentions that he's going to the village because there's a pretty girl working in the paper shop who thinks his card tricks are marvellous.

entities.name: muggles
entities.description: Muggles are mentioned as people who don't have magic. Fred explains that learning to peel sprouts without magic helps appreciate how difficult it is for Muggles.

entities.name: squibs
entities.description: Squibs are mentioned as people who don't have magic. Fred explains that learning to peel sprouts without magic helps appreciate how difficult it is for Squibs.

entities.name: paper shop
entities.description: The paper shop is mentioned as a location where George meets a pretty girl who thinks his card tricks are marvellous.

relationships.description: Ron asks Fred for help with peeling sprouts, but Fred refuses because it's character-building to do it without magic.
George is going to the village to visit the paper shop where he meets a pretty girl who thinks his card tricks are marvellous.
